result.execSummary:
The defendant Steven A Bunch was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Resisting or Obstructing an Officer, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 946.41(1).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: 5 day(s) RCJ for contempt for failure to pay.  $200 DNA surcharge assessed.
Deft may serve jail time on the weekends at 3 days at a time - Fridays, Saturdays and Sundays AS LONG AS THE JAIL PERMITS IT.
Defendant must submit a DNA sample as required by law.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Steven A Bunch
